plugins.name: Chat IO
plugins.description:
AI-Powered Chat Interface

- Interactive AI Assistant : Chat with an AI that analyzes your selected Figma content (text layers, frames, components)

- Context-Aware Responses : The AI understands your selected design elements and provides relevant feedback

- Multi-language Support : Automatically detects and responds in the user's language

- Conversation Memory : Maintains context between messages for coherent discussions


Smart Text Replacement System

- AI-Driven Content Generation : Replace selected text layers with AI-generated content based on custom instructions

- Multiple Layer Support : Handle single or multiple text layers simultaneously

- Pre-built Templates : Quick-access buttons for common tasks:

- Summarize : Condense text content concisely

- Improve Text : Enhance clarity, reduce repetition, fix sentence structure

- Improve CTA : Optimize call-to-action buttons following UX best practices

- Task Generator : Convert project descriptions into actionable to-do lists


Generate Task Flow

- Automatic annotation generation: Analyzes the selected frames in Figma and generates descriptive annotations for each one.

- A relevant title for each frame. A concise description that explains the purpose of the frame Interactive element marking:

- Automatically identifies all elements with prototype interactions within the selected frames.
plugins.tagline: AI-powered Figma plugin for intelligent content generation and design feedback using LLM API.

plugins.name: Tiny Exports
plugins.description:
Optimize your exported assets for web and mobile applications with just a few clicks.


Features

  1. Export layers with Figma‚Äôs export settings
  2. Support for layer naming conventions. Useful for setting exports in component libraries.
  3. Export individual layers or all at once
  4. Export only exportable layers under the current selection
  5. Support for TinyPNG compression (API key required) ‚Äì available for free
  6. WIP: Apply export settings automatically to all image layers
  7. WIP: Apply export settings to all manually selected layers
  8. WIP: Alternative image compression


How to Use

  1. Set Figma‚Äôs export settings or use the naming convention `export-[scale]x-[format]` (e.g., `export-1.5x-png`).
  2. Trigger the plugin in Figma while in design mode.
  3. Get a TinyPNG API key from [tinypng.com/developers](https://tinypng.com/developers) and enter it in the plugin‚Äôs Settings tab.
  4. Enable TinyPNG compression for optimized images.
  5. Use the plugin UI to export individual layers or all at once.


Naming Convention

SVGs or PDFs do not support `scale`. If a naming convention is present, it is preferred over Figma's export settings. It is recommended to use Figma's export settings if you can.

  1. Format: `export-[scale]x-[format]`
  2. `scale`: Any number (e.g., 2, 1.5) ‚Äì 1 by default
  3. `format`: png, jpg, svg, or pdf ‚Äì jpg is set by default


Examples:

  1. `imageName [export-1.5x-png]`
  2. `imageName [export-2x-jpg]`
  3. `imageName [export-jpg]`
  4. `svgName [export-svg]`


Security

  1. The TinyPNG API key is stored only locally
  2. The plugin uses a proxy to communicate with the API


Known Issues
plugins.tagline: Easily export all layers with TinyPNG compression.

plugins.name: Elemental
plugins.description:
Elemental lets you export images and copy color and shadow values in a single click‚Äîno need to set a layer to export, or break a color style to see the hex value. Elemental is built for those quick one-off moments when a developer needs an asset or another app is asking for your primary brand color.


What it does:

  1. Export one or more layers as images in your desired file type and size
  2. Copy the fill color of a layer to clipboard in your desired value type
  3. Copy the stroke color of a layer to clipboard in your desired value type
  4. Copy a layer's shadows in css format


How it works:

  1. Keep your Elemental panel handy
  2. Select a layer
  3. Click your desired export or copy button
plugins.tagline: Snag basic assets in a flash

This plugin allows you to bulk replace and export text layers in Figma using CSV files‚Äîperfect for efficient content updates and translation workflows.

Highly useful for localization, bulk edits, or working with external editors.


[Key Features]

‚ë†Bulk Replace Text

Simply upload a CSV file where column A = target text and column B = replacement text. The plugin will find and replace matching text layers in your Figma file.


‚ë°Export Text

Export text content from selected frames or layers into a CSV file. Ideal for translation or review processes.


[How to Use]

Open the plugin and go to the ‚ÄúReplace‚Äù tab to upload your CSV and execute replacement.

Use the ‚ÄúExport‚Äù tab to download the text from selected layers as a CSV file.

When a frame is selected, all text layers within that frame will be exported together as a CSV file.

plugins.name: SnapCap
plugins.description:
Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your FigJam board or Figma Design file in a single click, making it easier than ever to document user experiences as you browse the web.


Please note that to use SnapCap, you will also need to install the companion Chrome extension at snapcap.app/extension


How to Use SnapCap

Installation

  1. Install the Figma plugin
  2. Install the Chrome browser extension, and pin it


Session Setup

  1. Open the FigJam board or Figma Design file where you wish to send screenshots
  2. Launch the Figma plugin and click "Start new session"
  3. Copy the generated session code
  4. Click on the SnapCap browser extension and enter the copied session code


Taking Screenshots

Once your session has connected, click on the SnapCap browser extension anytime you want to take a screenshot and send it to your Figma file. A check mark will be shown on the extension icon to indicate that the screenshot was captured successfully, and it will show up moments later in the Figma file where the FigCap plugin is running.


Ending Session

When you are done taking screenshots, click the End button. If the SnapCap browser extension does not automatically disconnect, you can right click on the extension icon and select "End session"


Demo video and more at www.snapcap.app/
plugins.tagline: Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your Figma files

plugins.name: Fig-Refactor
plugins.description:
Call for Sponsorship: Support the Development


Fig-Refactor ‚Äì Replace Spacing with Figma Variables in One Click


Fig-Refactor is a Figma plugin designed to bring structure and scalability to your design files by replacing hardcoded gaps and paddings with Figma variables ‚Äî in bulk.


Fig-Refactor intelligently scans your selection or entire file, matches raw spacing values to the closest variable from your local or team library, and replaces them with a single click. It even skips values already using variables, keeping your workflow non-destructive and efficient.


‚ú® Features:

  1. üîç Smart matching ‚Äì Suggests the closest variable for each spacing value
  2. üß† Supports team libraries ‚Äì Load and use variables from shared libraries
  3. üìÅ Flexible scanning ‚Äì Target specific selections or scan the entire file
  4. üö´ Non-destructive ‚Äì Ignores values already assigned to a variable


Currently in active development, Fig-Refactor is already making design systems cleaner and easier to manage ‚Äî and with your support, it can go even further. Your sponsorship helps fund ongoing development, bug fixes, and new features like auto-thresholds, preview modes, and batch review.

Your support helps keep this plugin alive and evolving.

Thank you for making design better for everyone!

Effortlessly create, customize, and refine HTML emails in seconds with Denada. Your brand. Your voice. Your rules. It's like magic.


This plugin is the easiest way to export your Figma designs into Denada.


How to Export Images to Denada:


  1. In Figma, select a layer to export, then right-click > Plugins > Export to Denada
  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token

plugins.name: Maruco
plugins.description:
What is this?

Maruco is a plugin that provides rules and validation for component naming, helping you identify components that violate naming conventions and elements.


1. Selecting naming convention.

There are several conventions, let's select the best one for your project.


2. Entering naming elements.

Next, you can enter "words" that makes up the component's name.

Enter a comma between words to set multiple words.

Maruco guesses that the component's name is made up of three elements: a prefix, a middle word and a suffix.


3. Running validation.

That's all. Let's run the validation.
plugins.tagline: Effortless rule creation for component naming.

plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin enables users to create beautiful and interactive charts directly within Figma. Whether you need a bar, line, donut, or pie chart, the plugin offers real-time updates and customizable styles for seamless data visualization.


Function Description

  1. Create different chart types: Line, Bar, Donut, and Pie charts.
  2. Customize chart styles with predefined themes or use custom colors.
  3. Easily add, edit, and remove data rows with an intuitive interface.
  4. Export generated charts directly as Figma frames for further design use.
  5. Support for multiple languages, including English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select the chart type you want to create.
  2. Input the required data and choose a predefined color scheme or customize it.
  3. Set the chart dimensions (width and height) as per your design needs.
  4. Click "Generate Chart" to create the chart frame in Figma.
  5. Customize the chart further by adjusting colors and data points as needed.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports dynamic data updates and real-time chart previews.
  2. Ensure that all necessary data rows are filled to avoid incomplete chart generation.
  3. You can switch between chart types to explore different data visualizations.

plugins.name: WEMS for Figma
plugins.description:
WEMS is a powerful platform that transforms your Figma prototypes into fully functional websites or mobile app view in just a few clicks. Designed for modern creators and product teams, WEMS allows you to:


  1. Convert Figma designs into responsive websites or mobile app view
  2. Optimize pages with built-in SEO tools for website
  3. Add translations for multilingual support
  4. Integrate Lottie and Rive animations
  5. Embed MP4 or other embeddable videos (Youtube, Facebook, Vimeo, Twitch etc.)
  6. Support forms with inputs and data send to endpoint
  7. Integrate payment forms or buttons with own products
  8. Connect a custom domain
  9. Run A/B tests to experiment and improve
  10. Track performance with built-in analytics


With WEMS, you can go from design to deployment in record time ‚Äî no coding required

plugins.name: Palettly
plugins.description:
Palettly makes color palette creation effortless in Figma. Instantly generate harmonious color palettes from any base color and turn them into organized local styles with a single click. Preview your palette, customize naming, and streamline your design system workflow. No manual setup required. Perfect for designers who want fast, consistent, and beautiful color management right inside Figma.


What you can do with Palettly:

  1. Generate professional color palettes from any base color
  2. Instantly create local color styles for your Figma file
  3. Preview and fine-tune your palette before applying
  4. Use smart naming conventions for easy style management
  5. Save time and keep your design system consistent

plugins.name: Figma Slide Animation
plugins.description:
Figma Slide Animation Plugin

A Figma plugin that creates continuous animation transitions between selected frames.


Features

  1. Creates one continuous animation transition between selected frames
  2. Overwrites existing transitions between frames
  3. Ignores non-frame objects (Groups, etc.)
  4. Supports both vertical-first and horizontal-first transition priorities
  5. Dark mode and light mode support


Animation Settings

140005.name: Figma Slide Animation
140005.description:
Figma Slide Animation Plugin

A Figma plugin that creates continuous animation transitions between selected frames.


Features

  1. Creates one continuous animation transition between selected frames
  2. Overwrites existing transitions between frames
  3. Ignores non-frame objects (Groups, etc.)
  4. Supports both vertical-first and horizontal-first transition priorities
  5. Dark mode and light mode support


Animation Settings

Trigger : Next Page (‚Üí, ‚Üì, Enter), Previous Page (‚Üê, ‚Üë)
Action : Navigate to
Animation: Smart Animate
Curve : Ease In and Out
Duration : 300ms



Usage in Figma

  1. Select 2 or more frames in Figma
  2. Select direction priority (Vertical or Horizontal)
  3. Click "Create Animation" button

plugins.name: Procol Table Builder
plugins.description:
How to use the plugin?

  1. Import the "Procol Design System - Components" library into your design file.
  2. Place the components: "table-header" and "table-cell" onto the design file.
  3. Run the plugin.
  4. Select the number of rows and columns.
  5. Choose a cell size: Small or Default.
  6. Choose a header variant for the header row.
  7. Choose a table cell variant for all cells in a single column.
  8. Click on "Generate Table".


What you can do with the plugin?

  1. Generate tables of preferred number of rows and columns.
  2. Save tables as templates. (Beta testing)
plugins.tagline: Build tables using your own components. (Only for Procol Design Team)

plugins.name: Flow Sheets Sync
plugins.description:
Flow Sheets Sync connects your Figma design to live data from Google Sheets.


Easily map spreadsheet cells to text layers, update everything with a single click, and keep your layout always in sync with real content.


Ideal for multi-language designs, dynamic marketing layouts, or prototyping with real data.


Features:

‚Äì Visual mapping between cells and layers

‚Äì One-click sync directly from the sidebar

‚Äì Preserves text styles during updates

‚Äì Supports multiple sheets and projects

‚Äì No authentication or API keys required
plugins.tagline: Smart sync between Figma text layers and Google Sheets data.
